title: How to avoid the repetition of 'I' and 'me' while writing letters - Quora

response.answer_text: Would like to build up on Utkarsh Jain's answer. By replacing I/Me with We/Us (or any other word pertaining to same), you not only reduce the usage of those words but also bid with the readers better. For example. O-original; M-ModifiedO-I would like to point out, how these word can be easily replaced.M- We will see, how these word can be easily replaced. O- If I think, these words actually  do not disturb me that much.M-If We think, these words actually do not bother us that much. O- I will show you another approach to this problemM- Lets have a look at another approach to this problem. O-I can also omit these words easily while writing.M- These words can easily be omitted while writing. O- I applied the same approach in the first sentence.M- The same approach was applied in the first sentence. Hopefully helpful.

Use 'find and replace' in Microsoft Word. Replace 'I' with 'We' and 'Me' with 'Us'. After that, check for spelling errors (I'm to We'm to We've). We've been using it since 2000s, when Microsoft (company) brought this feature. It has made life a lot easier for us.
